result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Emmanuel T Hayes

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 10-25-2022

Defendant Emmanuel T Hayes appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Emmanuel T Hayes.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a plea hearing.  Defense informs the court that Mr. Hayes has tested positive for COVID and requests an adjournment.  Court ordered COVID documentation to be provided at the next court date.  Parties inform the court of new charges.  Court scheduled a status conference and informs Mr. Hayes that an IN PERSON appearance is REQUIRED.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-18-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 10-17-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 09-20-2022

Defendant Emmanuel T Hayes in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Emmanuel T Hayes.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. HEARING HELD OFF THE RECORD. Scheduling conference held. Defense is requesting a plea hearing. Court will accept all defendants matters for resolution. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.
Pretrial Services Violation Report

Defendant Emmanuel T Hayes in court with Attorney Theodore OReilly.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report

Court ordered no contact with ALL Walmart stores in Milwaukee Co.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Emmanuel T Hayes in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Emmanuel T Hayes in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Emmanuel T Hayes appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Emmanuel T Hayes not in court.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Initial appearance on March 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court was not in session on 2/22/2022, due to the weather courts were closed. Court date for 2/22/2022 has been vacated. Case adjourned to 3/31/2022, at 2:30 p.m. in OCCR. Notice has been mailed.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/22/22 @ 2:30p
